title: Golden Gate National Recreation Area: Be A Junior Ranger
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Kids & Youth     Be A Junior Ranger              Be A Junior Ranger       Welcome to the Golden Gate National Parks. Here at Golden Gate, we only have three different opportunities for you to participate in the Junior Ranger Program. There is one at Muir Woods National Monument, one at the Marin Headlands, and the last is on Alcatraz Island. Feel free to download and print a copy of your Jr. Ranger booklet prior to your visit or pick one up at our visitor center. Enjoy!        Illustration by Benny Batom NPS  Junior Ranger Activity Book—Alcatraz Island (PDF, 6 MB) Explore the mysteries of one of the most famous prisons in the United States. Uncover the different layers of histories that can be found during your visit. Are you ready to take the oath to become an Alcatraz Jr. Ranger?        Illustrations by Melissa West NPS  Junior Ranger Activity Book—Marin Headlands (PDF, 2.08MB) Explore the wonders of nature in the Marin Headlands just north of the Golden Gate Bridge. Learn about ocean ecology as well as the history of the inhabitants of years past, while taking up the oath to become a Jr. Ranger of the park.        NPS  Jr. Ranger Activity Book: Muir Woods NM Welcome to Muir Woods National Monument. Here at Muir Woods, you have an opportunity to participate in the Junior Ranger Program. Feel free to download and print a copy of your Jr. Ranger booklet prior to your visit or pick one up at our visitor center. Enjoy!     Check this out for additional information on other Junior Ranger programs within the National Park Service.
